Package de.tum.cit.fop.maze

Class ImmortalSnail

java.lang.Object
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.GameObject
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.Obstacle
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.Enemy
de.tum.cit.fop.maze.ImmortalSnail
public class ImmortalSnail extends Enemy
The Immortal Snail is a special enemy that adds a fun challenge to the game. This enemy is completely invincible and instantly kills the player on contact. It can phase through walls and slowly chases the player once it detects them.

Features: - Cannot be killed by the player (ignores all damage) - Moves in a straight line toward the player, ignoring walls - One-hit kills the player on contact - Uses ghost animations with a pulsing translucent effect

Stats: Very slow (4f), huge detection range (1500f), instant kill damage (999)

  • Constructor Details

    • ImmortalSnail

      public ImmortalSnail(float x, float y, MazeRunnerGame game)
      Creates a new Immortal Snail at the specified position. The snail starts idle but will begin chasing once it detects the player.
      Parameters:
      x - starting x position in world coordinates
      y - starting y position in world coordinates
      game - reference to main game for accessing ghost animations

  • Method Details

    • takeHit

      public void takeHit(int damage, float sourceX, float sourceY)
      Override of takeHit that makes the snail invulnerable. Player attacks do nothing except trigger a brief visual "hurt" effect for feedback. The snail's health never decreases.
      Overrides:
      takeHit in class Enemy
      Parameters:
      damage - the damage amount (ignored)
      sourceX - x position of the attack source (ignored)
      sourceY - y position of the attack source (ignored)

    • update

      public void update(float delta, Player player, MapManager mapManager)
      Updates the snail's movement and animation each frame. Unlike normal enemies, the snail moves in a straight line toward the player and completely ignores walls (phases through them).
      Overrides:
      update in class Enemy
      Parameters:
      delta - time passed since last frame in seconds
      player - reference to the player for targeting and collision
      mapManager - reference to the map (not used for collision since snail phases through walls)

    • draw

      public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch batch)
      Draws the snail with a ghostly pulsing effect. The snail has a translucent cyan tint that pulses to give it an ethereal appearance. Turns red briefly when hit by the player.
      Overrides:
      draw in class Enemy
      Parameters:
      batch - the LibGDX batch used for rendering
